snippet: Representatives of the two sides met again on Saturday but failed to reach an agreement. The dispute has left 8,000 utility workers locked out of their jobs for more than two weeks.
abstract: Pressure is rising on Con Edison and its biggest union, the Utility Workers Union of America, to resolve a contract dispute that has left 8,000 utility workers locked out of their jobs for more than two weeks, as New York City continues to be hit by heat waves; representatives for both sides meet again but fail to reach an agreement.
lead_paragraph: Representatives of the two sides met again on Saturday but failed to reach an agreement. The dispute has left 8,000 utility workers locked out of their jobs for more than two weeks.

headline.seo: Pressure Rises on Con Edison and Union to End Dispute
headline.main: Pressure Rises on Con Ed and Union to End Dispute
headline.print_headline: Pressure Rises on Con Ed and Union to Resolve Dispute
